definition: from the cradle to the grave (idiom); to go through fire and water/brave/willing to risk life and limb

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

sentences.english: He has distinguished himself many times at the risk of life since he joined the army.
sentences.chinese: 他參軍以來，出生入死屢建功勞。

sentences.english: Many people, even youth, were willing to sacrifice themselves for him.
sentences.chinese: 許多人，甚至是年輕人都心甘情願地爲他出生入死。

sentences.english: Bob is eager to review the previous Superman kind of go through fire and life.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃十分渴望重溫以前那種出生入死的超人生活。

sentences.english: You ready to follow Captain America into the jaws of death?
sentences.chinese: 願意跟着美國隊長出生入死嗎？

sentences.english: He is willing to die for the sake of his country.
sentences.chinese: 爲了他的祖國他願意出生入死。

sentences.english: Our journalists are constantly at risk of death.
sentences.chinese: 我們的記者經常出生入死。

sentences.english: The soldiers went through hell and high water to capture the fort.
sentences.chinese: 爲奪取該座堡壘，士兵都出生入死。

sentences.english: Soldiers go through fire and water together in the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 戰士們在戰場上出生入死。

definition: shared delights and common hardships (idiom); to share life's joys and sorrows/for better or for worse
to share joys and sorrows/sharing good times and hard times/same as 同甘共苦
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
fellow soldier
bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb/undaunted by perils
loyal and devoted (idiom); faithful and true
a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
to charge and break through enemy lines
blood-soaked
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
to attack the enemy
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
troops under one's command/subordinate
to die in battle (idiom)
as close as brothers (idiom); deep friendship
